LanguageData.BandwidthGizmoTip: An overseer can only oversee a cybernetica construct if there is enough bandwidth to do so. Each cybernetica construct consumes a different amount of bandwidth.\n\nGain more bandwidth by constructing band nodes and tuning the overseer to them, or by equipping special overseer apparel.
LanguageData.AlertMechLacksOverseerDesc:
One or more of your cybernetica constructs is not controlled. Connect your cybernetica constructs to an overseer with sufficient bandwidth to control them.

If left uncontrolled for more than a day, a cybernetica construct could go feral. When this happens they will join {0} and become hostile to you. If one cybernetica construct goes feral, it will bring other nearby cybernetica constructs with it.

Feral cybernetica constructs cannot be resurrected at a gestator when killed.
LanguageData.AlertMechLacksOverseerUncontrolled: The following cybernetica constructs are uncontrolled
LanguageData.AlertMechLacksOverseerMayGoFeral: The following cybernetica constructs are uncontrolled and could go feral at any moment
LanguageData.MechbandAntenna: Band nodes must be tuned to a specific overseer. This will add 1 bandwidth to that overseer's total bandwidth, allowing them to control more cybernetica constructs.\n\nOnce a band node is constructed, it can be quickly tuned to an overseer. However, retuning a band node to a different overseer takes significantly longer.
LanguageData.MechlinkBasic: A simple head-mounted comms computer that slightly enhances an overseer's control bandwidth. This allows them to control more cybernetica constructs.
LanguageData.MechlinkStandard: A head-mounted computer and signaling array that enhances an overseer's control bandwidth. This allows them to control more cybernetica constructs.
LanguageData.MechlinkAdvanced: An advanced head-mounted computer and signaling array that dramatically enhances an overseer's control bandwidth. This allows the wearer to control many more cybernetica constructs at once.
LanguageData.Apparel_MechlordHelmet: A heavy plasteel-weave helmet packed with overseer-assistance gear. The overseer helmet dramatically amplifies an overseer's bandwidth, but is somewhat less protective than dedicated heavy armor.
LanguageData.BandNodeTuningDesc: Tune this band node to an overseer. Tuning will take {0} to complete.
LanguageData.BandNodeRetuningDesc: Retune this band node to another overseer. Retuning will take {0} to complete.
LanguageData.DropThingBandwidthApparel: Removing {0} will change {1_labelShort}'s bandwidth from {2} to {3}. This will mean the following cybernetica constructs will no longer be under control
LanguageData.MechCarrierDesc: Release a swarm of up to {0} {1}. Each {2} costs {3} {4} to build. If the parent is destroyed then all the linked {1} will die. {1} cannot be recharged and will die once their power source runs out.
LanguageData.MechPowerCellTip: War urchins have a one-time power source. When the power cell runs out, the cybernetica construct dies.
LanguageData.MechStunPulseWarning: Cybernetica construct stun pulse on death
LanguageData.RemoteMechShieldTip: A remote shield projected by an overseer. It will attempt to stop incoming projectiles or shrapnel, but does nothing against melee attacks or heat. It prevents the wearer from firing out, and shuts down instantly if hit by EMP
LanguageData.AlertWarqueenHasLowResourcesDesc: One or more {0} are low on resources. They will be unable to produce cybernetica constructs on command if they run out of resources.
LanguageData.AlertRechargerFullDesc: Some cybernetica recharger(s) are storing their maximum number of toxic wastepacks. Cybernetica constructs can't use these chargers until the toxic wastepacks are hauled away.\n\nSelect a colonist and right-click a recharger to unload it.
LanguageData.AlertNeedMechChargersDesc:
You don't have rechargers for all your cybernetica constructs. If a cybernetica construct runs out of energy, it will fall into a dormant self-charging state and will recharge very slowly.

Build more of the following chargers:
{0}

Note: Only light cybernetica constructs can use regular cybernetica rechargers. Medium or heavier cybernetica constructs require large cybernetica rechargers.
LanguageData.AlertMechMissingBodyPartDesc: One or more of your cybernetica constructs are missing a body part. An overseer can repair lost parts.\n\nThe cybernetica constructs with lost body parts are
LanguageData.AlertMechNeedsRepairDescPrefix: These cybernetica constructs are damaged and need repair
LanguageData.AlertMechNeedsRepairDesc: Order an overseer to repair them, or select the cybernetica construct and turn on auto-repair. Repairing a cybernetica construct requires energy. If a cybernetica construct's energy is so low it can't move, someone must carry it to a recharger.
LanguageData.AlertBossgroupIncomingDesc: Signaled by your overseer, a hostile {0} is approaching with its combat escort. Be prepared, this won't be an easy fight. The hostile cybernetica constructs will arrive in a few hours or days.
LanguageData.CommandSelectAllMechsDesc: Select all cybernetica constructs controlled by this overseer.
LanguageData.CommandCallBossgroupDesc:
Signal an enemy Necron commander along with its escorts using forbidden binharic protocols.

If you defeat the commander, it will drop a special cogitator chip which you can use to advance your own cybernetica technology.

There are three commander types, each signaled a different way, each dropping a different type of cogitator chip.
LanguageData.CommandSelectOverseerDesc: Select the overseer who commands this cybernetica construct.
LanguageData.CommandAutoRepairDesc: If active, an overseer will automatically repair this cybernetica construct. Repairing a cybernetica construct drains its energy.
LanguageData.ConfirmInstallMechlink_Smithing: An overseer must be capable of smithing to create cybernetica constructs.\n\nAre you sure you want to continue?
LanguageData.ConfirmInstallMechlink_Intellectual: An overseer must be capable of intellectual tasks to unlock cybernetica research.\n\nAre you sure you want to continue?
LanguageData.MechanitorLeftMapWithoutMechs:
The following cybernetica constructs have been left behind by {PAWN_labelShort}:

{MECHS}

The cybernetica constructs will stay here until they are picked up.

Would you like to set their work mode to escort so they follow {PAWN_labelShort} off the map?
LanguageData.CaravanLacksMechMechanitorWarning: Your caravan contains a cybernetica construct but not their overseer. You will have limited control over the cybernetica construct when you reach your destination.
LanguageData.MechWorkActivitiesExplanation: The work activities that can be performed by this cybernetica construct.\n\nThe following list details which work activities can be done within each work type
LanguageData.MechRechargeSettingsExplanation: Change when cybernetica constructs will start and stop charging.\n\nCybernetica constructs with energy below this range will automatically seek out a recharger. They will stop charging once they reach the top of this range. These settings only apply in work mode.
LanguageData.MechWorkSkillDesc: The skill level that this cybernetica construct acts with.
LanguageData.MechGainsName: The cybernetica construct's name is now {0}.
LanguageData.MessageMechanitorCasketOpened: {0} was an overseer. You can remove {0_possessive} {1_label} and use it on a colonist.
LanguageData.MessageMechanitorLostControlOfMech: {0_nameDef} has lost control of a {1_kindBase} cybernetica construct
LanguageData.MessageMechChargerDestroyedMechGoesBerse: A cybernetica recharger was destroyed while {PAWN_nameDef} was charging! The power disruption has scrambled its cogitator core, and it is going berserk.
LanguageData.MessageCaravanAddingEscortingMech: Auto-adding {MECH_nameDef} to the caravan, since it is escorting {OVERSEER_nameDef}
LanguageData.MessageCaravanRemovingEscortingMech: Auto-removing {MECH_nameDef} from the caravan, since it is escorting {OVERSEER_nameDef}
LanguageData.DesignatorMechControlGroupDesc: Assign the selected cybernetica construct(s) to another control group under their current overseer.
LanguageData.RecipeRequiresMechanitor: The recipe {0} requires an overseer to work on it. None of your colonists are overseers, so nobody will do this bill.
